title: Susano
author: Susano
content: Which is the best?  Trading on bitcoin or investing in the stock market? The battle between short period earning and long-term earning. Share your thought about it.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: Susano on January 23, 2023, 05:14:06 PMWhich is the best?  Trading on bitcoin or investing in the stock market? The battle between short period earning and long-term earning. Share your thought about it.If I were Warren Buffett, I'll answer obviously the stock market and he's a long-term earner.But since we're in a bitcoin forum and I'm a bitcoin investor then I'd say that bitcoin is better for me because I've experienced the better things with it when I'm able to make a profit through it. And if you're struggling to choose, you're already in the forum and it's not just bitcoin trading but it also includes altcoins if you're for it. But instead of bitcoin trading,you may want to choose bitcoin holding instead.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: If you plan to hold for a long time, go crypto and forget about it. If you're looking to be more engaged and more active in your investment, go and pick stocks. Both will equally give you $$$, but stocks is way harder to get profits from and usually has movements that are very weak and incomparable against bitcoin. In bitcoin/crypto, you literally just buy and forget and come back after a year or two and you'll get profits. Minimal effort, maximum gains.

Share your thought about it.I will let you know first --which you prefer in trading, a very highly volatile market that is very risky or a market where all coins have a stable moment with less risk but I don't know regarding generating profit, as we know making a profit in a very high volatility cryptocurrency is very easy. comments.author: jackg
comments.body: Why are the twoo options trading bitcoin and investing in the stock market? What about trading the stock market or investing in bitcoin?If you're going into trading, you'll be best off starting to trade both to høne your skills and work out which one you're more accurate with/which you find easier.Investing brings a more stable long term growth but trading can bring higher returns than investing if done well.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Diversify investments into a lower risk that suit which is investing based on your skills. Investing or trading always matters in the skills and knowledge that you have.  In the historical records of stocks, there are a lot of people has been benefited and generated generous returns from it and it's possible on your side. Trading might be tricky, but if you've skills, go for it.Both markets are volatile, never expect a quick return or it's not guaranteed.  It's better for you to understand these circumstances before choosing the right for you.

comments.author: n0ne
comments.body: Diversifying the investment is good choice, but it needs to be done in the right way. I'm much used to cryptocurrency trading than investment into stock and other form of investment. I find cryptocurrency trading to be much easier than stocks and forex. One who have used to cryptocurrency trading will never think of other form of investment, though it have got high risk.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Diversification is needed, you can understand it as a way to minimize risk.You can invest in crypto and trade with it, while you can also invest in the stock market. Other than of that, you can also invest your money in property, land, gold and anything that allows you to make money. You can make money even if you don't make much. The best investment is not only about the possibility of making lot of profit, but you must consider the risks so that no matter how small the profit you will get, at least it can prevent you from losing lot of money. So I dare not say which one is the best, because in the long term even chicken eggs will be more expensive due to inflation.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: I prefer bitcoin and altcoin over stocks. I follow the strategy of using part of the capital for speculation and holding the bulk for long-term investment.Since there is now a bit of a rally in the market, Bitcoin and Altcoin are starting to move. Some good profits can be obtained by scalping on some pairs that have good volume.As for the second option, which is holding in the long term (especially Bitcoin), this remains the best option, because we have not entered the expected big bullish market until this moment.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Your question is like asking which is best — starting a business or getting a job. The answer will always depend on the person, with a lot of factors to take into consideration. Taking note that you already know the difference with concerning the time frame — so it can't really be one or the other. It can even be both.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Why not both? Yes, you can gain more in crypto trading if you have the right skills, this include day trading in alts/token rather than just holding BTC or ETH and we're talking in both bear and bull season. Investing in stocks might be best but only for long term, but you have more assurance that it won't go to zero or 50-80% down overnight unlike in alts/token imo.
